Description: Limestone sculpture of a cat. Top of plinth only roughly carved. The right rear legs is only partially blocked out. . the left long side of the cat is also only roughly carved, particulaly the left rear paw. Shoulder blades are pronounced and paws are both placed infront as if holding something down (area damaged, but no sign of a bird or other prey). Orange-brown paint survives in ears and around eyes. Black paint arount right eye. Tool marks visible over most of body. The plinth is completely smashed away. Face is worn, left ear chipped, head broken broken off and re-joined with plaster.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Alexandria (Egypt), probably Kom el-Dika temple of Bastet (probably)
